meanings.definition: To insert or place something firmly into something else
meanings.sent1: The dentist was implanting a new tooth into the patient's gum.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was implanting seeds into the soil for the next harvest.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly started implanting screws into the wrong part of the machine!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like seeds implanting themselves in his heart, growing into feelings of love.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flag implanting itself on the moon will forever be remembered.

meanings.definition: To establish or introduce something into a person's mind or consciousness
meanings.sent1: The teacher was implanting the importance of kindness in the students' minds.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement was implanting the idea of a luxurious lifestyle in viewers' minds.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotist joked about implanting the idea of dancing like a chicken in the audience's minds.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were like seeds implanting themselves in her mind, growing into nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song was implanting itself in his mind, refusing to leave.
